subject: Re: [junit] Looking for some "Best Practices"
msgSnippet: ...  ... To which page in his book are you referring ?  Cycles between packages are a definite no-no, but I don t know what the problem is between
messageBody:
On 11/25/02 8:11 AM, "Bill de h√ìra" <dehora@...> wrote:

>>
>> Is there a problem with having such cycles?
>
> Glad you asked. Normally I'd say yes - you don't want cycles in an
> object graph.

<<snip>>

>
> Bob Martin has a section in his new book on this subject, which is
> why I've thinking about it again. Cycles are to be avoided, and one
> answer he proposes is to apply a dependency inversion to the code.

To which page in his book are you referring ? Cycles between packages are a
definite no-no, but I don't know what the problem is between classes within
a package.

--
Robert Koss, Ph.D. | Training, Mentoring, Contract Development
Senior Consultant | Object Oriented Design, C++, Java
www.objectmentor.com | Extreme Programming
